meanings.definition: A long staff with a pointed metal tip, used as a weapon or for support while walking.
meanings.sent1: The guard held a sturdy pikestaffs during the night watch.
meanings.sent2: The knights carried their pikestaffs proudly into battle.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy squire mistook the pikestaffs for fishing rods!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as sharp as a pikestaffs in battle.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the pikestaffs in the sunlight was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The plural form of pikestaff, referring to multiple long staffs with pointed metal tips.
meanings.sent1: The armory was stocked with various pikestaffs for the soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The display showcased an array of ornate pikestaffs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children used the pikestaffs as pretend swords in their game.
meanings.sent4: The pikestaffs stood tall like a forest of metal trees.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pikestaffs clashing echoed through the courtyard.
